text: Arizona Proposition 139 is a change to the law that will be voted on November 5, 2024 in the state of Arizona. Abortion is currently legal in Arizona if a person is pregnant for 15 weeks. Arizona Proposition 139 asks voters if they would like to have the right to abortion to be legal in the state after 15 weeks. More than 50% of voters in Arizona need to agree to this change for it to become a law. == References == Category:Arizona Legislature Category:2024 elections in the United States
title: 2024 Arizona Proposition 139
